tradition: Decorating altars commonly called ofrendas that are built in homes and cemeteries along with offerings of food and drink.
New year celebration where red decorations symbolize luck, red envelopes with money are exchanged and family reunites with one another.
People gather around a bonfire and place a fake witch figure typically made of straw in the bonfire. Today people gather for family night and have a good time.
Thousands gather to engage in a massive tomato fight and pelt each other with ripe tomatoes.
Families gather, give thanks for their blessings and share a traditional meal that includes turkey.
People light up their homes and the streets with millions of white and colored candles in patterned paper lanterns.
A traditional ritual that has practiced for centuries that takes place in a special room called a chashitsu and led by a trained host.
Canadians across the country take a plunge into the icy-cold waters to welcome the new year with an invigorating start.
Groups of children dress in scary costumes roaming from house to house saying trick or treat.
